page.title: 10A Towering Landmark.
page.content: {Bishops Wood}water tower a local land- mark, can be seen from all around. The 26m high reinforced concrete reservoir with a diameter of 12-5m, stands on a stem (2-7m internal diameter) and holds 455 cubic meters (100,000 gals.) approx. 1 days water supply for the area. A reinforced concrete roof stops rain water and other forms of polluti- on contaminating the drinking water. The now{Severn Trent Water Authority built it in 1971, the elevation of the site enabling the water supply to flow by gravity. A borehole pumping station at Worsley 2KM away supplies the water. Thought was given to make its appearance compatible with its surroundings.The area itself is the subject of a "Tree Preservation Order" and so care was taken during building to avoid damage to certain Oak and Silver Birch trees. (M.Dickson)
